frontmatter.title: Note on order theory terminology in UF

mainmatter.p: In this note, I briefly summarize some discussions that I (Ayberk Tosun) have had with Tom de Jong and Mart√≠n Escard√≥ and present my proposal for changes to order-theoretic terminology in UF.

Similar order-theoretic terminology is used in
the work [1; 2] de Jong and Escard√≥ on order theory in univalent foundations; and
the work [3] of Tosun and Escard√≥ on locale theory in univalent foundations.
Recall de Jong and Escard√≥'s notion of \mathcal{V}-dcpo.
Let \mathcal{V} be a universe. A poset D is a \mathcal{V}-dcpo if the join of of every \mathcal{V}-family on set D exists in D.
The analogous fundamental notion in the work of Tosun and Escard√≥'s work on locale theory in UF is that of a ( \mathcal{U} , \mathcal{V} , \mathcal{W} )-frame.

frontmatter.title: Frame (type-theoretic)
frontmatter.meta: Defn. 2.4 from Patch Locale of a Spectral Locale in Univalent Type Theory

mainmatter.p:
A ( \mathcal{U} , \mathcal{V} , \mathcal{W} )-frame L consists of a
a type |L| : \mathcal{U}
a partial order - \le - : |L| \to |L| \to \Omega _{ \mathcal{V} },
a top element \mathbf{1} : |L|,
an operation - \wedge - : |L| \to |L| \to |L| giving the greatest lower bound U \wedge V of any two U, V : |L|.
an operation \bigvee - : \mathsf{Fam} _{ \mathcal{W} }(|L|) \to |L| giving the least upper bound \bigvee _{i : I} U_i of any \mathcal{W}-family \left \{ U_i \right \} _{i : I}.
such that binary meets distribute over arbitrary joins, i.e. U \wedge \bigvee _{i : I} V_i = \bigvee _{i : I} U \wedge V_i for every U : |L| and \mathcal{W}-family \{ V_i \} _{i : I} in |L|.

A fundamental notion that arises in both of these lines of research is that of a basis for the respective notion of lattice in consideration. Even though the notion of lattice in consideration varies, the notion of basis does not.

frontmatter.title: Intensional basis for a dcpo in UF

mainmatter.p: Let D be a \mathcal{V}-dcpo. An intensional basis for D is a \mathcal{V}-family (B, \beta ) on D satisfying the condition: for every element x : D, there is a specified directed \mathcal{V}-family (K_x, \kappa _x) on the basis index B such that x = \bigvee (K_x, \beta \circ \kappa _x)
In de Jong's thesis, the term ‚Äústructurally continuous‚Äù is used for a \mathcal{V}-dcpo equipped with a basis satisfying
Let \mathcal{V} be a universe. A poset D is a \mathcal{V}-dcpo if the join of of every \mathcal{V}-family on set D exists in D.

frontmatter.title: Frame (type-theoretic)
frontmatter.meta: Defn. 2.4 from Patch Locale of a Spectral Locale in Univalent Type Theory

mainmatter.p:
A ( \mathcal{U} , \mathcal{V} , \mathcal{W} )-frame L consists of a
a type |L| : \mathcal{U}
a partial order - \le - : |L| \to |L| \to \Omega _{ \mathcal{V} },
a top element \mathbf{1} : |L|,
an operation - \wedge - : |L| \to |L| \to |L| giving the greatest lower bound U \wedge V of any two U, V : |L|.
an operation \bigvee - : \mathsf{Fam} _{ \mathcal{W} }(|L|) \to |L| giving the least upper bound \bigvee _{i : I} U_i of any \mathcal{W}-family \left \{ U_i \right \} _{i : I}.
such that binary meets distribute over arbitrary joins, i.e. U \wedge \bigvee _{i : I} V_i = \bigvee _{i : I} U \wedge V_i for every U : |L| and \mathcal{W}-family \{ V_i \} _{i : I} in |L|.
PhD Student at the University of Birmingham.

frontmatter.title: Patch Locale of a Spectral Locale in Univalent Type Theory
Domain theory in constructive and predicative univalent foundations
